title: Isolate the Quadratic Term and Make Its Coefficient One
text: We add $$50$$ to both sides to get $$x^2$$ by itself which gives $$x^2=50$$. Since the coefficient of $$x^2$$ is $$1$$ already, we do not need to take extra step.
speech: We add  50  to both sides to get  x squared  by itself which gives  x squared is equal to, 50 . Since the coefficient of  x squared  is  1  already, we do not need to take extra step.

title: Use Square root Property
text: The square root property: if $$x^2$$ $$=$$ k, then $$x$$ $$=$$ $$\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=$$ $$-\sqrt{k}$$. $$x^2=50$$, we can take square root both sides and get $$x=\sqrt{50}$$ or $$x=-\sqrt{50}$$.

title: Simplify the Radical
speech: Simplify  minus the square root of 50 .

title: Final Answer
text: Therefore, $$x^2-50$$ $$=$$ $$0$$ has two solutions which are $$x=5\sqrt{2}$$ and $$x=-5\sqrt{2}$$.
